title: Lis Neris 2010 Tal Lùc White (Venezia Giulia)
description: Made with dried Verduzzo and Riesling grapes, this sweet wine offers aromas of ripe apricot, baked apple and pressed flower. The palate delivers dried orchard fruit, orange zest and vanilla. It ends on a note of acacia honey.

title: McGregor 2014 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Sunny, peachy sweetness abounds in this light-footed Riesling. Off dry in style, it's breathlessly fresh and fruity, yet intensified by shimmering lime and mineral tones. Drink now for its youthful effervescence.

title: Lone Madrone 2012 Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: A fairly uncommon grape for the entire Central Coast, this bottling offers squeezed blueberry and dark purple fruit aromas bolstered by black pepper and black rocks. Lighter in body than expected upon the sip, the palate shows cola, bright cranberry juice and a sandalwood spice that makes it very easy to drink.

title: Finn Hill 2012 Bon Mot Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)
description: The aromas offer barrel spices, toast, black licorice and red fruit while the palate brings dark fruit flavors with a grainy feel. The oak (100% new French) juts out a bit and overrides the fruit.

title: Hidden Jewel 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: The Nashville-based R.S. Lipman Company, formerly just a Tennessee distributor, comes west for this deal of a wine, with lime blossoms, pink grapefruit and Gala apple slices on the nose. The palate is clean, crisp and rounded with lime spritzer and green-apple flavors.

title: Domaine Zinck 2013 Terroir Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Ripe pear on nose and palate is the central theme on this broad-shouldered and richly textured wine. A dollop of sweetness is countered with fresh lime acidity that concludes in ripe accord.

title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2014 Los Vascos Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: Aromas of cherry and currant are a bit flat. On the palate, this is perfectly good but common. Blackberry, plum and a dusting of chocolate are the key flavors, while this runs long and loamy on the finish.

title: Domeniile Panciu 2012 Feteasca Neagra (Panciu)
description: This wine made from an indigenous Romanian grape has a bouquet of red raspberry, tart cherry, and clove with a touch of brambles. Flavors of cassis, cherry vanilla, red plum and raspberry work their way across the palate, concluding in an agreeably spicy finish.

title: Millbrook 2013 Proprietor's Special Reserve Pinot Noir (New York)
description: Touches of balsamic vinegar, violet and wet granite lend complexity to this crisp, elegant Pinot Noir. Black cherry and plum flavors are penetrating and pristine, finishing with a fringe of dusty tannins.

title: Pieropan 2011 Le Colombare  (Recioto di Soave)
description: Produced with dried Garganega grapes, this boasts aromas and flavors of dried apricot, baked apple, citrus zest and toasted sensations. It ends on a note of roasted hazelnut.

title: Red C 2014 Allan Nelson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fresh-squeezed lemon and jalapeño open the bouquet of this wine, kosher-made in Berkeley by Covenant. With the right pairing, it'll sing, offering medium texture and a lengthy finish, the acidity balanced and in keeping with the fresh elements of tropical fruit and citrus.

title: Rock Wall 2012 Heringer Vineyard Teroldego (Yolo County)
description: Floral aromas like lilac and lavender, then dry and substantial flavors like blueberry and boysenberry give this full-bodied wine an interesting personality. It tastes well structured with acidity and tannins, so it's well balanced and has an appetizing sense of reserve that will be great at the table.

title: Paul Blanck 2014 Gewurztraminer (Alsace)
description: Rounded rose and honey notes with inflections of apple and Mirabelle are cut very pleasingly by the citric freshness of tangerine peel. This is easy drinking, medium bodied and aromatic.

title: Standing Sun 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tight aromas of earthy pencil lead, extreme pine aromas and black pepper show on the nose of this bottling. It's tart and bright on the wound-up palate, with plum skin, oregano and thyme, providing a very focused take on the grape.

title: Merryvale 2012 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: A soft and layered expression of dense black cherry, chocolate and spicy tobacco, this is easy to enjoy and approachable, rich and round. A taste of black licorice dots the finishing moments.

title: Mesa Del Sol 2011 Sangiovese (Arroyo Seco)
description: Dusty and leathery on the rustic nose, this shows slightly sour dried red fruits and anise. The palate is all about earth—sand, clay, dirt, etc.—along with plump, ripe cranberries and cinnamon spice.

title: Monte Zovo 2009 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)
description: This opens with aromas that recall leafy underbrush, prune, mushroom and tilled soil. The hefty palate offers raisin, toasted oak, coffee and licorice accompanied by tightly woven, close-grained tannins that leave a rather drying finish. Drink soon to capture remaining freshness.

title: Guenoc 2013 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine captures the popular grapefruity, grassy style of the variety in a crisp, refreshing and flavorful way. Light to medium bodied and full of bracing acidity, it will be great with seafood or as a pre-dinner drink.

title: Hahn 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Warm aromas of red cherries, star anise and cinnamon greet the nose with inviting brown spice scents on this entry-level bottling. Cinnamon, cranberry and black plum show on the palate, along with pencil-lead minerality and a tart plum-skin finish.

title: Henri de Villamont 2012 Les Champs Claude  (Santenay)
description: With a good structure, this is a solid wine from a small vineyard. It is dense with tannins as well as dark berry fruits and fresh acidity at the end. The wine will age well over the next few years, so drink from 2017.

title: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Lime pith, sharp gray slate, steel and a warmer lemon-curd aroma show on the nose of this wine from a region between Morgan Hill and Gilroy. Apples and pear-skin bitterness mark the palate that grows riper through the sip.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2012 Curtis Vineyard Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rich aromas of black cherry, anise seeds and buttered violets greet the nose on this dense bottling of a grape that rarely gets solo treatment. The palate is tarry and grippy, with dried sour cherries, boysenberry, black pepper and tightly grained cedar flavors that approach pine sap.

title: Sipp Mack 2014 Tradition Riesling (Alsace)
description: While the nose gives little away here apart from the slightest lemon flavors, the palate is lightly textured and shows straitlaced lemon freshness with bright rays of zesty fruit. It's an ideal, refreshing apéritif for warm summer days.

title: Domaines Schlumberger 2013 Les Princes Abbés Riesling (Alsace)
description: A closed nose leads to a softly apricot-fruited palate. Tension and structure are provided by a streak of fresh lemon acidity that tones the body and gives a lighter, clear accent to the sonorous fruit.

title: Domeniile Panciu 2013 Casa Panciu Băbească neagră (Panciu)
description: Garnet in the glass, this wine made with an indigenous Romanian variety features a bouquet of cherry preserves and raspberry pie. Flavors of both cooked and fresh cherry carry through on the palate into the persistent fruit-filled finish.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Collection Riesling (Alsace)
description: The mellowness of baked apple envelops all other aromas. While the baked apple is also apparent on the palate, it is pulled into sharp focus by fresh, lively and bright lemon acidity.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2012 Block 137 Merlot (Finger Lakes)
description: A plume of fresh blossoms and herbs lends lift to this plush, full-bodied Merlot. Luscious, creamy swirls of blackberry and cherry syrup penetrate deeply on the palate but are contrasted by sharp notes of sour cherry and cranberry. It's a brawny, fruit-forward wine, but not overbearing in stature.

title: Lone Birch 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of cherry, baking spices, cocoa and herbs are followed by dark fruit and vanilla flavors with a creamy feel. It's a bit oak-driven but overall it works.

title: Lone Madrone 2013 Oveja Negra Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: With 58% Mourvèdre, 20% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 2% Counoise grapes from the dry-farmed, head-pruned Old Oak Vineyard (formerly Sheep Camp Creek), this wine shows dried black cherries, pencil lead, uncrushed cloves and nutmeg on the nose. The palate is flatter, with cooked cherries as well as other dried purple and red fruits.

title: Lucien Albrecht 2014 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Generous, sweet pear fruit tumbles out over palate and throat, held carefully in check by fresh zestiness. This is about easy fruit and simple pleasure, held in beautiful balance. Drink soon.
